User provide high-level research directi.Format: Natural language instructions describing the experiment and desired hypothesis generation focus.
User provide high-level research directi.Example: I want you to analyze the table and come up with interesting conclusions and hypotheses. Note that your hypotheses should be novel and specific.
User provide high-level research directi.Role in workflow: Sets the scope and focus for the multi-agent system's hypothesis generation.

User provide structured, domain-specific.Format: LaTeX-formatted tables with compound IDs, mass/charge, retention times, compound names, and sample origins.
User provide structured, domain-specific.Example: Mass spectrometry data table listing compounds, M/Z, RTs, and sample sources.
User provide structured, domain-specific.Role in workflow: Provides the structured experimental data for analysis and hypothesis generation.

User provide research papers.Format: User-selected research papers converted to Markdown using pymupdf4llm.
User provide research papers.Example: Ten astrobiology research papers and a book provided as background context.
User provide research papers.Role in workflow: Grounds the agents in relevant literature for context-aware hypothesis generation.

User provide datasets other than researc.Format: Mass spectrometry datasets from meteorite and soil samples.
User provide datasets other than researc.Example: GCxGC-HRTOF-MS data from eight meteorites and ten soils.
User provide datasets other than researc.Role in workflow: Empirical evidence for pattern extraction and hypothesis support.

Structural or Entity Decomposition.Method details: Compounds in the dataset are assigned unique IDs and grouped by chemical class (e.g., PAHs, sulfur-containing, terpenes) for targeted analysis.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Inputs: Mass spectrometry data table with compound IDs and classes.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Outputs: Subsets of compounds for each scientist agent to analyze.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Example: Planner assigns PAH analysis to one agent, sulfur/oxygen compounds to another, alkylated aromatics to a third.
Structural or Entity Decomposition.Role in workflow: Enables focused, feature-level reasoning by agent specialization.

Workflow Decomposition.Method details: A planner agent divides the analysis into sub-tasks, delegating each to a specialized scientist agent.
Workflow Decomposition.Inputs: Data analyst's summary of patterns and user instructions.
Workflow Decomposition.Outputs: JSON-formatted instructions for each scientist agent.
Workflow Decomposition.Example: Planner instructs Agent 1 to analyze PAH distribution, Agent 2 to investigate sulfur/oxygen compounds, etc.
Workflow Decomposition.Role in workflow: Creates parallel, domain-specific hypothesis generation workflows.

Pattern and Feature Extraction.Method details: Data analyst agent identifies significant patterns, anomalies, and contamination indicators in the mass spectrometry data.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Inputs: Mass spectrometry data, user instructions, literature context.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Outputs: Key observations and highlighted molecular patterns.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Example: Detection of methylated naphthalenes only in meteorites, or terpenes only in soils.
Pattern and Feature Extraction.Role in workflow: Provides empirical basis for hypothesis generation.

Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Method details: Literature review agent queries Semantic Scholar API for papers relevant to each generated hypothesis.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Outputs: Up to five relevant paper snippets per hypothesis.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Example: Semantic Scholar search for 'methylated naphthalenes in meteorites'.
Literature and Data Retrieval via APIs.Role in workflow: Provides literature evidence for hypothesis evaluation.

Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Method details: Literature review agent synthesizes and summarizes key findings from retrieved papers for each hypothesis.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Outputs: Concise summaries highlighting relevant findings and conflicts.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Example: Summarized analysis of PAH formation mechanisms from multiple papers.
Concise Synopsis and Summarization of Li.Role in workflow: Condenses literature evidence for hypothesis critique.

LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Method details: Planner agent decomposes the analysis into sub-tasks, each handled by a scientist agent generating hypotheses for their assigned data segment.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Inputs: Planner's JSON instructions, compound subsets, literature context.
LLM Agent Generate ideas/hypotheses via.Example: Scientist 1 generates hypotheses about PAH alkylation in meteorites.

Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Method details: Scientist agents are prompted as domain experts (e.g., astrobiologist, prebiotic chemist) and generate hypotheses based on their assigned chemical class.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Inputs: Compound subsets, literature context, agent instructions.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Outputs: Domain-specific hypotheses with supporting data points.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Example: Scientist 2 hypothesizes about sulfur incorporation in meteorites.
Generate ideas/hypotheses using Domain-S.Role in workflow: Leverages specialized knowledge for hypothesis quality.

Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Method details: Selected research papers are provided as background context to data analyst and scientist agents during hypothesis generation.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Example: Hypotheses referencing known PAH formation pathways.
Literature data used during idea/hypothe.Role in workflow: Ensures hypotheses are grounded in current scientific knowledge.

Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Method details: Scientist agents use patterns identified by the data analyst (e.g., exclusive presence/absence of compounds) to generate hypotheses.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Outputs: Hypotheses linking observed patterns to chemical processes.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Example: Linking methylated naphthalenes in meteorites to abiotic alkylation.
Idea/hypothesis generation via Pattern D.Role in workflow: Transforms empirical patterns into mechanistic hypotheses.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: Critic agent evaluates hypotheses for clarity, novelty, plausibility, and scientific rigor, providing structured feedback.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Outputs: Critique with strengths, weaknesses, and improvement suggestions.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: Critic agent assesses hypotheses for alignment with domain-specific processes (e.g., PAH formation, parent body chemistry).
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Example: Critic notes preservation bias in methylated naphthalene hypothesis.
LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Role in workflow: Ensures domain relevance and scientific validity.

LLM-based Hypothesis/Idea evaluation via.Method details: Critic agent integrates literature review findings to assess empirical and theoretical support for each hypothesis.

Refinement via LLM Agent Feedback Loops.Method details: Critic agent's feedback is sent to the data analyst, who refines subsequent analyses and hypothesis generation in iterative cycles.
